bug.author: alexlatchford
bug.summary: Bug: Deleted tfx/BUILD after git clone
bug.description:
<denchmark-code> ‚úò ÓÇ∞ ~/Code/kubeflow ÓÇ∞ git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tfx.git --verbose Cloning into 'tfx'... POST git-upload-pack (gzip 13415 to 6658 bytes) remote: Enumerating objects: 13, done. remote: Counting objects: 100% (13/13), done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (13/13), done. remote: Total 19658 (delta 2), reused 3 (delta 0), pack-reused 19645 Receiving objects: 100% (19658/19658), 175.09 MiB | 5.57 MiB/s, done. Resolving deltas: 100% (14631/14631), done. ~/Code/kubeflow ÓÇ∞ cd tfx ~/Code/kubeflow/tfx ÓÇ∞ ÓÇ† master ‚óè ÓÇ∞ git status On branch master Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'. Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed) (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory) deleted: tfx/BUILD no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") </denchmark-code>
I cloned this repo without problems yesterday (or maybe 14th) so guessing something has happened between that timeframe. My env:
Mac OS X 10.15 git 2.18.0
As far as I'm aware there are no git hooks in the tfx repo, I got a co-worker to recreate this on his machine so don't think it's my laptop unless I missed some requirement I need to pre-install. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
I was investigating <denchmark-link:https://travis-ci.com/github/kubeflow/pipelines/jobs/361767089>this build failure</denchmark-link> for so guessing it may be affecting the Travis CI build machines too.

comments.comment:
Even stranger looks like any attempts I make to run git reset fail and actually make it a different error üòì : <denchmark-code> ~/Code/kubeflow/tfx ÓÇ∞ ÓÇ† master ‚óè ÓÇ∞ git reset --hard HEAD is now at 22b50ab6 Merge pull request #2104 from 18jeffreyma:master ~/Code/kubeflow/tfx ÓÇ∞ ÓÇ† master ‚óè ÓÇ∞ git status On branch master Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.
Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed) (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
deleted: tfx/build/BUILD deleted: tfx/build/gen_proto.sh
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") </denchmark-code>
Also can't seem to get rid of these unstaged changes using git checkout -- tfx/BUILD üòï

Looking through the commits going to guess this is related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tfx/commit/96a3f4fa81e6f02e49c698e9bd216a13925b69b3>96a3f4f</denchmark-link>
Apologies if I've missed something I needed to do. cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chongkong>@chongkong</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
In case this matters I'm using a pretty old version of Bazel to ensure it can work with the kubeflow/pipelines repo: <denchmark-code> ‚úò ÓÇ∞ ~/Code/kubeflow/tfx-043b2b7e93c31f36ab205826953d4c233c74d7df ÓÇ∞ bazel version Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it... Build label: 0.23.1 Build target: bazel-out/darwin-opt/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar Build time: Mon Mar 4 10:40:32 2019 (1551696032) Build timestamp: 1551696032 Build timestamp as int: 1551696032 </denchmark-code>

Looking through the commits going to guess this is related to 96a3f4f
yep, we changed our local debugging processed (above PR updates the instruction), bazel is now needed
Apologies if I've missed something I needed to do. cc @chongkong In case this matters I'm using a pretty old version of Bazel to ensure it can work with the kubeflow/pipelines repo: ‚úò ÓÇ∞ ~/Code/kubeflow/tfx-043b2b7e93c31f36ab205826953d4c233c74d7df ÓÇ∞ bazel version Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it... Build label: 0.23.1 Build target: bazel-out/darwin-opt/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar Build time: Mon Mar 4 10:40:32 2019 (1551696032) Build timestamp: 1551696032 Build timestamp as int: 1551696032
